title: 111_hr3903
content: The Act titled "Securing Tomorrow by Saving Today Act of 2009" exempts certain interest income from tax under a new section 116 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The "Securing Tomorrow by Saving Today Act of 2009" excludes interest income from gross income for individuals, with limitations on the maximum amount excluded based on the taxable year. The "Securing Tomorrow by Saving Today Act of 2009" increases the $550 amount annually based on the cost-of-living adjustment. Interest for this section includes interest on deposits with a bank and amounts paid in respect of deposits or investment certificates. The "Securing Tomorrow by Saving Today Act of 2009" increases the annual amount based on the cost-of-living adjustment. It pertains to withdrawable or repurchasable shares from certain financial institutions, with specific provisions for nonresident alien individuals regarding tax implications. Conforming amendments are also made to related sections of the Code. Amendments are made to various sections of the Code, including section 86(b)(2) and section 135, to coordinate with section 116. Amendments are made to sections 265(a)(2), 584(c), and 643(a) of the Code to include provisions related to interest income under section 116. Amendments are made to include interest income under section 116 in various sections of the Code. Interest excluded from gross income pursuant to section 116 is to be included in the calculation. Amendments made to include interest income under section 116 in various sections of the Code. Effective date for amendments is for taxable years beginning after December 31, 2008. Increase in dollar limitations on contributions to retirement plans. The amendment increases the dollar limitation on deductions for contributions to individual retirement plans under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. It also affects simple retirement accounts by adjusting the applicable dollar amount for taxable years. In taxable years 2009, 2010, or 2011, the applicable dollar amount for contributions to defined contribution plans is temporarily increased to not less than $33,000. This amendment also raises the combined employee and employer limitation on contributions to such plans. In taxable years 2009, 2010, or 2011, the dollar amount for contributions to defined contribution plans is temporarily increased to not less than $65,500. The amendments apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2008. SEC. 4. INCREASE IN PERMITTED CATCH-UP CONTRIBUTIONS TO RETIREMENT PLANS. SEC. 4. INCREASE IN PERMITTED CATCH-UP CONTRIBUTIONS TO RETIREMENT PLANS. Temporary increase in permitted catch-up contributions for taxable years 2009, 2010, and 2011 to not be less than $10,000. Special rule for individual retirement plans during the specified years. The dollar amount in effect under clause (i) shall not be less than $10,000. The amendments made by this section apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2008. SEC. 5. SUSPENSION OF MINIMUM DISTRIBUTION REQUIREMENTS. The text discusses the suspension of minimum distribution requirements for eligible defined contribution plans from 2008 to 2012 under specific sections of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Eligible plans include defined contribution plans exempt from tax and annuity plans. The text discusses the suspension of minimum distribution requirements for eligible defined contribution plans from 2008 to 2012 under specific sections of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Eligible plans include annuity plans, annuity contracts, eligible deferred compensation plans, and individual retirement plans. Special rules apply to determine the required beginning date for individuals under certain code sections for calendar years after 2009. The text discusses the suspension of minimum distribution requirements for eligible defined contribution plans from 2008 to 2012 under specific sections of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Special rules apply to determine the required beginning date for individuals under certain code sections for calendar years after 2009. Provisions relating to plan amendments are also outlined. The subsection applies to plan amendments made in accordance with specific regulations on or before the first plan year starting after January 1, 2009. From the date of enactment of this Act, plan or contract amendments made before the first plan year starting after January 1, 2009, will be treated as if they were in effect until December 31, 2009.
